name: Eleven Westgate

reviews.text: A weekend with friends is always a pleasure, but a weekend with friends where you are looked after by Mike and Amanda (and their charming children!) is a rare treat. If you want a genuinely warm welcome, a quality breakfast and comfort like you get at home (but without all the hard work!), look no further than Eleven Westgate. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Think home from home, then double it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a package of 2 nights b & b and a day of mountain bike skills instruction which worked out very good value. The b & b is very well set up for mountain bikers but would also be great for walkers or anyone wanting to explore the area. The skills instruction was a fantastic day and the rooms are really comfortable, all en-suite. I would definitely consider another trip with the instruction.
reviews.title: Just what I had hoped for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weekend started with a warm welcome from our hostess Amanda. On arrival we were shown to a cosy en suite room, and offered afternoon tea and homemade cakes.
reviews.title: Welcoming hosts, who took us from novice to expert...!

reviews.text: There was a varied and excellent choice at breakfast, which set us up for the day ahead with our host/instructor, Mike.
reviews.title: It's not just for mountain bikers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was with trepidation and knees knocking (not good when going mountain biking) I agreed to go on a days mountain bike instruction with my husband, (a keen mountain biker).
reviews.title: Great stay at 'Number Eleven'

reviews.text: The location, accommodation , hosts were excellent. We travelled with some friends for a nice relaxing weekend which is exactly what we got. Amanda helped us in supplying all the information regarding places too eat and visit that we requested. The start of each day was to be served with a very good breakfast, good choice, even Whitby kippers.
reviews.title: excellent all round experience

reviews.text: For the steam train enthusiasts the station is only a 5 minute walk away . All in all a very good base to explore the delights of North Yorkshire.
reviews.title: An unforgettable weekend

reviews.text: Thanks to Mike and Amanda we had a PERFECT weekend: it all started with a good night of rest in tastefully decorated, comfortable, modern rooms, followed by a delicious breakfast cooked out of farm-fresh ingredients (I'm missing that porridge with honey already!). We then had a whole day of mountain biking instruction by Mike in Dalby forest. Mike is a fantastic coach: on the first morning we only started suspecting that most of our ideas on how to ride a mountain bike were wrong, but by night we were completely converted into the new technique and had a full complement of the most up-to-date riding skills to take home and practice! The greatest fun was to test the tricks Mike taught us on all those berms, drop-offs and bomb holes which I never thought I'd be able to ride. When we came back we were treated to some delicious flapjacks cooked by Amanda. Outrageously good! And the best thing ever? In the morning we had to do it all over again! We will be coming back for more, especially because Amanda is getting her instructor's badge soon – we need all the instruction we can get!
reviews.title: Brilliant for anyone who loves ridin!!!
Great stay
reviews.text: This trip is a great one, for anyone wishing to develop their skills. Coaching was really good, I learnt a lot about body positions, and how to conquer technical pieces of terrain. Lessons are all done in a friendly environment, with only positive criticism, which really helped me to see my mistakes. The accommodation was brilliant, clean and comfortable, with delicious cooked breakfasts in the morning and flapjacks for when you get off the trails. The instructor also runs a local bike shop which sorted out all the damages on my bike, very good service. I would really enjoy coming back here, and hopefully will.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at Number 11. Very warm welcome by Amanda on arrival. Our room was spacious and very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and certainly set us up for the day. Information in our room was helpful as were the maps and walking books we could make use of. We can highly recommend this bed and breakfast in Pickering which has many restaurants to choose from too and a great location to explore the North York Moors and coast.
reviews.title: Dream home from home!

reviews.text: Well located B&B on the edge of the North Yorkshire moors. Wonderful accommodation and extremely good breakfasts using locally sourced produce, well presented by Amanda. Charming and chatty children. Lots of choice locally for evening meals. Would recommend highly. Liz & Tony Roberts, Milton Keynes
reviews.title: Very welcoming family B&B with excellent accommodation and 5 star food.

reviews.text: Having stayed at this B & B for a girlie mountain biking week-end with instruction from the host last November, we took our seasoned biker husbands with us this week-end for another ride in the amazing Dalby Forest. Even though I had stayed before Mike and Amanda exceeded my expectations and my husband, who does not normally enjoy Bed & Breakfast establishments couldn't fault the place or the excellent welcome and service given by our hosts. The house and rooms were still immaculate, the beds are so comfy, and the breakfast is the best you will experience in a b & b with all produce locally sourced and cooked so that your full english is actually healthy! Mike & Amanda even gave us all lifts to a concert they happened to be going to as well. If you ever need to stay in a B & B for any reason, in Pickering, do not give Eleven Westgate a miss!
reviews.title: Beyond Expectation - everything has been thought about and nothing is too much trouble.

reviews.text: We had an absolutley great time. We were there to Mountain Bike and found both the accommodation and guiding excellent. The rooms are spotless with ensuite facilities and breakfast was spot on also with a good selection of cereals. Mike does the cooking and I can highly recommend the full cooked breakfast, just what you need before a ride in Dalby or the moors.
reviews.title: Midweek Perfection

reviews.text: We were made to feel very welcome by all the family. An excellent place and one we will visit again soon.
reviews.title: Too good to be true....

reviews.text: 5 of us travelled from the North East of England, an area laden with great MTB opportunities to experiance the North Yorkshire Moors and Dalby Forest. Having found Big Bear Active in a magazine classified section we booked up based on nothing more than a gut feeling and a few friendly emails.
reviews.title: The Ultimate Rough with the Smooth

reviews.text: Mike and Amanda have created a unique B&B experience. With every base covered, from a very warm welcome, perfect bedrooms and the best breakfast to set you up for the day.
reviews.title: Fantastic accomodation and the warmest welcome

reviews.text: If you’re mountain biking its perfect, a real home from home with everything you need from bike wash facilities and a workshop through to secure bike storage for that additional piece of mind.
reviews.title: What a place to go mountainbiking from

reviews.text: A warm, friendly welcome from Mike and Amanda. The room and facilities for bikes were absolutely great.
reviews.title: First rate accommadation & the ultimate biking weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It felt just like home from home, which was lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Good to know my bike was clean, safe and secure, and that it would get fixed if I managed to break it!
reviews.title: I want to move in!

description: Eleven Westgate is an elegant Victorian home retaining many of its original features, which have been carefully restored to provide light airy rooms with a relaxed homely feel. The deceptively large house has quality furnished rooms, all en-suite with lots of home comforts. There is a large lounge where you can relax in front of a log burner for cosy evenings in with loads of books and current magazines to read or put your feet up and watch Sky+HD or a DVD. We are close to the centre of Pickering where there are many great shops with loads of places to eat and drink, all just a short stroll away.
